text: I work at Cornell University I just
recently started just in the last couple
of weeks started as a director of
infrastructure but prior to that I was
an assistant director in infrastructure
I think it was around 2013 that we
signed a contract with Amazon and about
that time we found that we had quite a
bit of activity in Amazon already
happening across campus recently over
the last year year and a half we've been
delivering course software through app
stream it helps us deliver sort of
consistently to all students on their
own devices it's really increased the
sort of instructor student interaction
with the software which which has really
opened a lot of doors one of the things
that we talk about a lot as a team is
just because the right solution for a
problem yesterday was that solution
doesn't mean that's the right solution
today and that's really hard for
technologists because they want to say
oh there's a problem I know the solution
to that we did it we've done it before
and that's not always the case anymore
it's really important that we're looking
at things with new eyes based on what
technologies are available we have this
challenge and higher education to really
give students a real war real-world
experience before they graduate and
getting them access to the software that
they would use in the real world that
they can use sort of day in day out is a
huge is a huge step in that direction
